sentence.Network_en: The issue of Okinawa thus was urgent when he assumed office.
sentence.Network_cn: 他上台时,冲绳问题变得更加紧张了.

sentence.Network_en: Sato privately expressed " deep gratitude " to Nixon for this " magnanimous " decision to return Okinawa.
sentence.Network_cn: 佐藤对尼克松归还冲绳的 “ 宽宏大量的 ” 决定曾私下表示 “ 深为感激 ”.

sentence.Network_en: The deadline was met ; Okinawa was officially turned over to Japan on May 15,1972.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个限期没有超过, 冲绳在1972年5月15日正式交给了日本.

list.abs: 在冲绳岛(Okinawa Island)最好是有辆车——国际驾照也是必须得有的哦! 房间的设备及其完善,三个人住这儿非常的宽敞。床也很特别…

means.word_mean: 1. the largest island of the central Ryukyu Islands

2. a campaign in the closing days of World War II in the Pacific (April to June 1945); in savage close-quarter fighting United States marines and regular army troops took the island from the Japanese; considered the greatest victory of the Pacific campaign
